metadata.feature_description: Generate RSS feed for activity stream content

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Access RSS Feed from Activity Stream

steps.expected: Activity Feed page loads with activity stream posts
steps.actual: Activity Feed page loaded successfully showing multiple activity stream posts with user interactions

steps.action: Scroll to view RSS feed icon in Activity Stream
steps.expected: RSS feed icon should be visible in the Activity Stream module
steps.actual: RSS feed icon visible near the 'Get More' button at the bottom of the activity stream

steps.expected: RSS feed should generate and display valid RSS 2.0 XML content
steps.actual: RSS feed opened in new tab displaying valid RSS 2.0 XML with channel info (title, link, language, pubDate, generator) and multiple item elements containing activity stream posts with title, description, author, comments, guid, and pubDate

observations: RSS Feed functionality is implemented in ActivityStreamFeed.ascx control which is loaded when view=rssfeed parameter is present
RSS feed uses the ActivityStreamRssFeed class (Components/Rss/ActivityStreamRssFeed.cs) to generate RSS 2.0 compliant XML
The RSS feed includes namespace declarations for journal and slash modules
Feed title is dynamically generated as '[Portal Name] Most recent journals'
RSS feed supports filtering via query parameters: groupid, journaltypeid, pagesize, includebody
The RSS icon opens the feed in a new browser tab (target='_blank')
